critique: The most likely diagnosis in this patient with a right upper lobe density on chest film is apical lung cancer (Option A), sometimes referred to as a Pancoast tumor or superior sulcus tumor. These tumors may present with shoulder pain, weakness and atrophy of the muscles of the hand, and Horner syndrome (ptosis, miosis, and anhidrosis), caused by compression or involvement of C8, T1, and T2 nerve roots and the paravertebral sympathetic chain.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
question_text: A 57-year-old man is evaluated for right shoulder pain. Physical examination of the shoulder is normal.Chest radiograph is shown.
